item.title: Jocylynn add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "Was everyone else really as alive as she was?...If the answer was yes, then the world, the social world, was unbearably complicated, with two billion voices, and everyone's thoughts striving in equal importance and everyone's claim on life as intense, and everyone thinking they were unique, when no one was." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Jocylynn add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jocylynn add a quote by zadie smith
item.description: "She wore her sexuality with an older woman's ease, and not like an awkward purse, never knowing how to hold it, where to hang it, or when to just put it down." -- zadie smith

item.title: Jocylynn add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jocylynn add a quote by Toni Morrison (total goddess)
item.description: "Here ... in this here place, we flesh; flesh that weeps, laughs; flesh that dances on bare feet in grass. Love it. Love it hard. -- Toni Morrison's Beloved " -- Toni Morrison (total goddess)
